alert.note: Alert for Fergus County below 4500ft; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:16PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Judith Basin, western Fergus and south central Chouteau Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 216 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles west of Denton, or 14 miles north of Stanford. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coffee Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
